Comment: I'm a competitive fencer. I'd like to point out it's FAR more than 30%. All our classes and open bouting is coed. That's probably 90% of matches. There isn't a safety concern. I regularly fence with 9 year olds, and 70 year olds. There's always something to learn from everyone because it's mostly a technique and strategy based sport. If we were to segregate practices by gender then women would be negatively impacted. There are far fewer women athletes in the sport and they would have far fewer people to practice against.  As was noted in the hearing, a plurality of competitions are coed because otherwise women wouldn't have enough competitions to compete and get ratings in. In my region women only tournaments are really hard to find due to lack of competitors. I wish that wasn't the case, and I'm proud of the USA Fencing board for making recruiting more women to the sport a huge priority. The same people who are campaigning against these recruiting efforts are the ones leading the charge of banning trans athletes and arguing its to protect women. Hypocrisy.
